configuration.mailchimp_subject_line: September updates: Run Wireguard VPN, build a security camera in 30 mins or less, and some BLE beacon fun
configuration.mailchimp_preview_text: Monthly updates on projects, features and events from balena September 2020

featured.text:
Hello there, readers!

By popular demand, we created a guide on how to run Wireguard VPN in balenaOS. Our team also got to the bottom of USB temperature issues on the Fin v1.1.

From the lab, we showed edge developers, hackers, and makers how to build an IoT surveillance camera in 30 minutes, and how to get started with BLE (Bluetooth low-energy) item trackers. We learned how one balenista improved their IoT app development process using balena (to better spy on their cat).

As always, see highlight our favorite community projects of the month. Check them out and take care.

news.title: Addressing the balenaFin v1.1 USB temperature issue
news.text: Take a look at this root cause analysis of the balenaFin v1.1 USB temperature issue, learn why we’re recalling affected units, and see how we’re addressing the problem to make a better board.

news.title: How to run Wireguard VPN in balenaOS
news.text: Responding to user requests, we created this guide on running Wireguard VPN in balenaOS. Check it out, try it out, and let us know how to make it even better.

posts.title: Can you make a security camera system in 30 minutes?
posts.text: The answer is yes. Hardware Hacker Phil shows you how in this guide that needs a USB webcam and a spare Raspberry Pi.

posts.title: Track all your items with low-energy Bluetooth beacons
posts.text: Tired of losing your things? This project lets you use Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) beacons and Raspberry Pi sensors to help you track all your stuff.

posts.title: How a cat inspired better IoT app development
posts.text: Learn what drove this balenista to improve their remote-accessible cat camera using the latest IoT tools and workflows.

projects.title: Community Spotlight: David Groom (IShotJr) shares projects on the livestream
projects.text: We had David Groom (aka IShotJr) on the IoT Happy Hour recently to share what he’s been hacking on. Check out the episode, like, and subscribe to see more of our weekly show.

projects.title: Containerized image classification all on a Raspberry Pi
projects.text: Check out this Edge Impulse project by @aureleq that runs image classification using a Raspberry Pi and camera.

projects.title: balenaSound continues to gain new users
projects.text: We’re glad that users continue to build and enjoy balenaSound, like @mashimom here. We’re hard at work on new features for the project, so stay tuned!

projects.title: Prototyping plant monitoring with balena
projects.text: We gave an early look at balenaPlant to our community members who tuned into the IoT Happy Hour and answered quite a few questions. Check it out and let us know what you think.

charlie.text: Did you know that you can now speed up your development process by combining livepush with custom monitors? By using the dev-cmd-live directive, you can override the existing Dockerfile’s CMD when running livepush to use nodemon, webpack-dev-server, or your program of choice. Read more about livepush and it’s directives here.

events.text:
We’re postponing our physical events to practice safe social distancing and keep our team safe and healthy. Instead, meet with us virtually during our weekly IoT Happy Hour!

Every Friday at 16:00 UTC, join our live stream to see IoT project builds, discuss hardware and software, talk shop, answer community questions, and more.
